data.title: Twins announce giveaways during next homestand
data.meta_description: The MN Twins are back in town this weekend and will be going up against the Cleveland Guardian, but they’ve decided to prepare a number of special items for guests in attendance of the games.
data.text:
MINNEAPOLIS-ST. PAUL, Minn. (KTTC) – The MN Twins are back in town this weekend and will be going up against the Cleveland Guardian, but they’ve decided to prepare a number of special items for guests in attendance of the games.

Tickets for all four games are available online and, for a limited time, will include no fees. By using the code ALShowdown at checkout, fans can purchase tickets with no additional ticket fees. The deal is available through August 8, midnight.

Friday, August 9 vs. Cleveland Guardians doubleheader Game 1 (1:10 p.m.; gates open at 12:00 p.m.)

Gate Giveaway - Kids Beanie: The first 5,000 kids aged 12-and-under through the gates will receive a Twins beaning.

Friday, August 9 vs. Cleveland Guardians doubleheader Game 2 (7:10 p.m.; gates open at 6:00 p.m.)

Twins City Connect Friday: The Twins will wear their new Nike City Connect uniforms for the seventh time.

Postgame Fireworks Show: Fans are invited to stick around following the game for a fireworks show.

Saturday, August 10 vs. Cleveland Guardians doubleheader Game 2 (6:10 p.m.; gates open at 4:00 p.m.)

612 Saturday: Get to Target Field when gates open for 612 Saturday! From 4 p.m. until first pitch, fans can enjoy $6 drink specials, $1 snacks and $2 food specials.

Twins Hall of Fame Induction presented by Coordinated Business Systems: Longtime general manager Terry Ryan, the architect of the Twins’ division-winning teams of the 2000s that are widely credited with helping save baseball in Minnesota, and the late Rick Stelmaszek, whose 32 seasons as a Twins coach from 1981-2012 remains the longest in team history and the third-longest tenure with a single club in baseball history, will become the 39th and 40th members of the Twins Hall of Fame during pregame ceremonies.

Gate Giveaway – Twins Hall of Fame Pin: The first 5,000 fans in attendance will receive a Twins Hall of Fame pin featuring Terry Ryan and Rick Stelmaszek.

Plaque Unveiling: Terry Ryan and members of Rick Stelmaszek’s family, including his wife Kathie, will join fans on Target Plaza at 4:15 p.m. as the pair’s Twins Hall of Fame plaques are officially unveiled.

Induction Ceremony: Terry Ryan and the late Rick Stelmaszek – represented by his wife, Kathie – will be formally inducted into the Twins Hall of Fame during special pregame ceremonies, celebrated on the field by family and friends. The induction ceremonies will be emceed by longtime Twins television voice and current club special assistant Dick Bremer.

Sunday, August 11 vs. Cleveland Guardians doubleheader Game 2 (1:10 p.m.; gates open at 11:00 a.m.)

Gate Giveaway – Twins City Connect Backpack: The first 5,000 kids 12-and-under in attendance will receive a backpack styled in the Twins City Connect colors.

Celebrating the Washington Senators: The Twins will honor the legacy of the Washington Senators and celebrate the club’s 1924 World Series championship, the first in franchise history.

Gate Giveaway – Replica Game 7 Tickets: The first 10,000 fans in attendance will receive a commemorative, replica ticket from Game 7 of the 1924 World Series; the replicas were produced by Premier Southern Ticket, the same company that printed the originals 100 years ago under the name Simplex Ticket Company. The replicas all feature Section B, Row 1, Seat 7 – the seat of the ticket kept in the personal scrapbook of Senators Hall of Fame pitcher Walter Johnson and likely was held for Game 7 by his wife, Hazel.

Walter Johnson Hall of Fame Plaque Photo Opportunity: For the first time since the National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum officially opened in 1939, Walter Johnson’s plaque is leaving Cooperstown and will be on display in Truly On Deck from the second through seventh innings; fans have the rare and exclusive opportunity to take a photo with the plaque of the Senators legend.

Pregame Ceremony: The Twins will honor the Washington Senators and celebrate the 100th anniversary of the franchise’s first World Series title with an on-field ceremony prior to the game. The 1924 World Champion Senators will be represented by Clark Griffith II (grandson of team owner and Hall of Fame executive Clark Griffith), Hank Thomas (grandson of Hall of Fame pitcher Walter Johnson), Allie Utley (curator of the Walter Johnson Collection in his native Humboldt, KS), and Lynn Bluege-Rust and Carol Leber (daughters of infielder, manager and longtime front office executive Ossie Bluege). Additionally, the Twins will welcome the following representatives of the Washington Senators’ legacy as a charter member of the American League: Sherry Ann Robertson Dayton (daughter of former player and longtime farm director Sherry Robertson) and Hall of Fame pitcher Jim Kaat, who made his major league debut with the Senators in 1959.

100th Anniversary Patch: Twins players and coaches will wear a special sleeve patch with a logo commemorating the 100th Anniversary of the 1924 World Series champion Washington Senators.

“Team of Destiny” Book Signings: Beginning at 11:00 a.m. until first pitch (or book supplies last), author Gary Sarnoff will be in Truly On Deck signing his book, “Team of Destiny: Walter Johnson, Clark Griffith, Bucky Harris, and the 1924 Washington Senators.” A limited number of copies will be available for purchase.

Washington Senators Memorabilia: Displays featuring select Washington Senators memorabilia will be on display outside of Truly On Deck.

Kids Day: Every Sunday home game at Target Field is Kids Day! Among the activities:

Kids’ meals are half price – just $4 – at select concession stands.

A member of the T.C. Sluggers Kids Club will be the Play Ball kid.

Families can enjoy all the fun of Bullseye’s Backyard, located on the Gate 34 Lawn, featuring interactive activities including Big Catch, Run the Bases and a coloring mural to let kids of all ages leave their mark on Target Field. Kids can print their own baseball cards, win ticket upgrades, get a custom screen-printed bag or bandanna and even the chance to be selected as the Target Ball Kid for a game.

Postgame, kids can run the bases.

Season, group, and single-game tickets for the Twins’ 2024 regular season home schedule at Target Field are available online, by calling (612) 33-TWINS or 1-800-33-TWINS, or in-person at the Target Field Ticket Office.
